group_1.textLeft: Oh, Your Reverence!
Thank you very much for taking the trouble@to come here...

group_1.textRight: Not at all, don't worry about it. I had some business@to attend to with the Chairman as well.
So, I heard there was something you wanted@to ask me about...

group_1.textLeft: Yes, I need some advice.@You see, actually...

group_1.textRight: ...My, to think that little girl San from back then@would be consulting me for love advice...
The years go by so fast...

group_1.textLeft: What the...?!@That's not what I'm talking about at all!
I'd like you to hear Lady San out properly!

group_1.textRight: Ha ha, that was just a jest.
Then, what's the actual topic?

group_1.textLeft: I'm trying to spread the word about the god@worshipped at Hikarizuka Shrine and the Fire Festival,
so that even people with little faith@will take an interest in it...
So, please tell me once again about the god and@the origin of the Festival if you don't mind.

group_1.textRight: Ohh...! With you youngsters being all@so enthusiastic about it,
of course I don't mind.

group_1.textLeft: Then, then!@Please tell us about that right away!

group_1.textRight: Well, it's a shame, but I've got some business to@attend to later today...
How about, uhh, tomorrow, or the day after?

group_1.textLeft: Too late, that's too late!
Couldn't you do something about it,@Your Reverence...?

group_1.textRight: Well, if you're in such a hurry...
I suggest you read a book called@"The Faith of Hikarizuka."
It's an easy-to-read compilation of old shrine@documents and local lore.
I'm sure you can find it in the library.

group_1.textLeft: Thank you very much, Your Reverence!@I'll look for it!

group_1.textRight: This is the first time we've really looked into@the origins of the Fire Festival.

group_1.textLeft: Well, the shrine's information board does have@a description of its history.
But this has more details...

group_1.narration: When a certain shrine was destroyed in a huge fire,@a young girl holding the sacred Vessel@emerged from the flames unharmed.

The people of Hikarizuka, who believed that@this girl was a familiar spirit of the fire god,@built the Hikarizuka Shrine@and started the Fire Festival@as a ritual to welcome the god@into the world once a year.

group_1.textRight: Wait, the god worshipped at the shrine was a girl?!

group_1.textLeft: Looks like it.
...But haven't you noticed something?@If the lore is true...
..."Able to stay unharmed in flames"...
We have an idea what a girl with such power@would be, don't we?

group_1.textRight: Uh...
...[wait:0.8][chara:103201:cheek_0][chara:103201:motion_400][chara:103201:lipSynch_1]Ah! A Magical Girl...?!
If so, if so!
Are you saying that the god of Hikarizuka Shrine@was a Magical Girl...?!

group_1.textLeft: Perhaps, a long time ago, back when the Festival@first started...
Humans worshipped Magical Girls as gods@and asked them to guide them.

group_1.textRight: ...Hmm, I think I heard something like that@somewhere...

group_1.textLeft: What do you mean...?@[chara:103101:lipSynch_0][wait:0.8][chara:103101:motion_400][chara:103101:cheek_0][chara:103101:face_mtn_ex_050.exp3.json][chara:103101:lipSynch_1]...Ohh!

group_1.narration: "As Magical Girls, we represent@the next stage of human evolution.@In other words, we can be thought of@as 'the chosen ones'!"

"If we, Magical Girls, who have contributed sooo much@to the development of human society and civilization,@get to be the leaders of humanity, we'd be able@to build a wayyy more advanced civilization,@while also increasing our own value!"

group_1.textLeft: What Lady Touka was talking about...@"Magical Girl supremacy"...?!
Once upon a time in this region...
Magical Girls were recognized as gods...
Well then... that's it...!
If you're a Magical Girl, you can make yourself@a visible god...!

group_1.textRight: Huh...@What does that mean?

group_1.textLeft: It means that a being who can take the place@of the god is standing right here.

group_1.textRight: ...Oh! You're going to become a god, Lady San...?!

group_1.textLeft: That's right, Miyu.@If I can become a visible god...
Then we'll be able to restore the faith in the@Hikarizuka Shrine and keep the Fire Festival alive.

group_1.textRight: Good idea, good idea!

group_1.textLeft: To do that...@We'll spread Magical Girl supremacy...
...to surely protect the Fire Festival.

group_1.textRight: Yes!
... Ah, but, but Lady San!
How do we spread the word about Magical Girl@supremacy...?

group_1.textLeft: Oh, right...@It's hard for us to do this on our own, so...
...Let's try to get in touch with that new@Wings of the Magius.
